alert.note: Alert for Goshen; Laramie; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 21 at 3:11PM MST until December 21 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 311 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Chugwater to South Greeley, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Interstate 25 and 80 near Cheyenne. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, La Grange, Burns, Chugwater, South Greeley, Hillsdale, Ranchettes, Hawk Springs Campground, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Warren Af Base, Meriden Rest Area, Gun Barrel, Carpenter, Slater, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
